decision_conditions: The proposed amendments would fundamentally alter the outbuilding approved under planning permission ref: 23/01282/HOU (Erection of a single storey detached outbuilding for residential annex accommodation for purposes ancillary to the residential use of the dwelling at 2 Lynton Close) by enabling the outbuilding to funcition as an independent unit of residential accommodation. The proposed amendments cannot be sought via Section 73A of The Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended)

Notwithstanding the first reason for refusal, the subdivision of the plot would result in the establishment of an additional independent unit of accommodation would give rise to an over-intensive use of the site and lead to an unsatisfactory relationship between independent dwellings in conflict with policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The development as a whole would result in an unacceptable urbanising effect and would appear incongruous when viewed from neighbouring properties, causing harm to the character and appearance of the existing site and wider area, contrary to Policy DM10 of the Kingston Core Strategy (2012), the Residential Design SPD (2013) and the NPPF (2023).

Notwithstanding the first reason for refusal, it is considered that the proposed development would cause undue noise and disturbance to neighbours, contrary to Policy DM10 of the Kingston Core Strategy (2012).
description: Application under Section 73 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 to carry out development without compliance with Condition 1 (Drawings) for Application Reference Number: 23/01282/HOU	(Erection of a single storey detached outbuilding for residential annex accommodation for purposes ancillary to the residential use of the dwelling at 2 Lynton Close) dated 02/08/2023. Variation to consist of addition of front porch and solar panels to roof.
